TEXT.TITLE: LAWSON REPEATS HE IS CONTENT WITH STERLING LEVEL
TEXT.BODY: U.K. Chancellor of the Exchequer Nigel today repeated that he was satisfied with the current level of sterling, both against the dollar and the West German mark. Lawson said in a television interview that he did not regard the pound's present exchange rate was uncomfortably high. "I think it is round about right," he said. "I think there was a time that they (British manufacturers) thought the (exchange) rate was uncomfortably high. But I think they are very satisfied with the present level." "But I have made it absolutely clear that I don't want to see the pound go through the roof," he added. Reuter
